Description: In 2011 I attended field camp in New Zealand and my study abroad in Christchurch was cut short by the 2011 Canterbury Earthquake. The following summer I studied the Canterbury region to identify repeating earthquakes within the aftershock sequence, which ultimately became my senior thesis at Colorado College.

Place: Eel River Critical Zone Observatory, CA
Description: Geophysical data collection (Seismic refraction, electrical resistivity, and surface nuclear magnetic resonance).

My Master’s thesis at the University of Wyoming was an integrated interpretation of the Snowy Range watershed, combining existing remote sensing data and airbone electromagnetic data (acquired by SkyTEM).
Various geophysical studies including seismic reflection data (pre-stack and stack) and well logs from the prospect scale to play scale across the GOM.
